entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued December 03 at 9:03PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Elevated Sea Levels Sunday Night Through Tuesday... Water levels will begin rising along the Arctic Coast from Utqiagvik west on Sunday night, with the highest levels expected on Monday. Water may push up on top of the sea ice, and could cause ice to pile up on beaches from Utqiagvik west. No infrastructure flooding is expected at this time. Residents with
entry.cap:areaDesc: Northern Arctic Coast; Western Arctic Coast

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued December 03 at 1:34AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Elevated Water Levels Possible Sunday Into Wednesday Along South and West Facing Coastlines... A series of storms moving north through the Bering Sea and into the Southern Chukchi Sea over the weekend and into next week will bring a period of strong southerly winds to the West Coast from the Yukon Delta northward to Point Hope. The strong southerly
entry.cap:areaDesc: Chukchi Sea Coast; Eastern Norton Sound and Nulato Hills; Southern Seward Peninsula Coast; St Lawrence Island and Bering Strait Coast; Yukon Delta

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued December 02 at 3:02PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...AREA CREEKS EXPECTED TO REMAIN HIGH THROUGH THE WEEKEND... Recent cold temperatures have caused area rivers and streams to increase in stage due to freeze-up. Localized ice dams have formed on Peter`s Creek near Stoltze Bridge, as well as Campbell Creek in Far North Bicentennial Park near Basher Dr. Localized bankfull conditions to minor flooding have been reported in these

entry.title: Winter Storm Warning issued December 03 at 1:30PM PST until December 05 at 4:00AM PST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM PST MONDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected with a 10-15% chance of lightning. Additional snowfall accumulations of 3 to 12 inches, 3 to 7 inches at Lake Tahoe level and 12 to 34 inches above 7500 feet. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph on Lake Tahoe with waves up to 4 feet. Sierra ridge wind gusts of 80-100 mph possible.

entry.summary: ...AIR QUALITY ALERT: MANDATORY WOOD BURNING CURTAILMENT IN EFFECT... entry.title: Flood Warning issued December 03 at 8:44PM EST until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... St Johns River Near Astor affecting Volusia and Lake Counties. .The Saint Johns River at Astor remains in Minor Flood stage. It is forecast to continue a very slow fall while remaining within Minor Flood stage for the foreseeable future. Residents and interests along the river will continue to see Minor flood impacts.

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 03 at 1:44PM MST until December 05 at 11:00AM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM SUNDAY TO 11 AM MST MONDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches. * WHERE...Jackson Hole. * WHEN...From 11 AM Sunday to 11 AM MST Monday.

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 03 at 1:44PM MST until December 05 at 11:00AM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM SUNDAY TO 11 AM MST MONDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Wind River Mountains West and Wind River Mountains East.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Wind River Mountains East; Wind River Mountains West
